Name: starelid
column6: the table or index that the described column belongs to

Name: staattnum
column6: the number of the described column

Name: stanullfrac
column6: the fraction of the column's entries that are null

Name: stawidth
column6: the average stored width, in bytes, of nonnull entries

Name: stadistinct
column6: the number of distinct nonnull data values in the column. a value greater than zero is the actual number of distinct values. a value less than zero is the negative of a fraction of the number of rows in the table (for example, a column in which values appear about twice on the average could be represented by stadistinct = -0.5). a zero value means the number of distinct values is unknown.

Name: stakindn
column6: a code number indicating the kind of statistics stored in the nth "slot" of the pg_statistic row.

Name: staopn
column6: an operator used to derive the statistics stored in the nth "slot". for example, a histogram slot would show the < operator that defines the sort order of the data.

Name: stanumbersn
column6: numerical statistics of the appropriate kind for the nth "slot", or null if the slot kind does not involve numerical values.

Name: stavaluesn
column6: column data values of the appropriate kind for the nth "slot", or null if the slot kind does not store any data values. each array's element values are actually of the specific column's data type, so there is no way to define these columns' type more specifically than anyarray.
